text.text_translated: Some cities have tried to stop artists from painting graffiti in random places, which is drawing or writing on walls without permission, by giving them special areas where they can work. Taiwan, for example, has created “graffiti zones” where artists can paint and write on walls legally. In São Paulo, Brazil, the city council has even let some graffiti artists decorate the subway trains.
